accomplishments: Developed and taught the first iteration of CI 487 - Data Structures for CS Teachers for the College of Education
Listed among "Instructors Ranked as Excellent" for the Spring 2021 semester
Instructor of record for the Summer 2021 semester
Worked in a team environment, both locally and remotely, to design and implement a web scraper and PDF processor for data collection purposes.
Performed Social Network Analysis (SNA) on student interactions within the Piazza Q&A site in an effort to quantify the impacts of instructor-student interactions.
Analyzed the effects of formative feedback systems, specifically one developed using Travis-CI, Git, GitHub, Gradle, and GitHub Classroom, and its effects on student performance and behavior.
Worked on a meta review project that sought to investigate the state of performance prediction research in STEM
Adapted data collection scripts for a system aimed at the early detection of academically at-risk students.
Analyzed the impact of factors such as prior experience, validated test results, and self-efficacy on students' abilities to succeed in introductory computer science courses.
Volunteered to tutor computer science pre-majors on the subject including discrete math, language theory, computer systems, data structures, algorithms, as well as fundamentals or programming.

projects.title: CodeSpec
work: Integrating automatic distractor generation and feedback generation into the platform's existing Parsons problems generation system
Working on Knowledge Component (KC) modeling and automatic KC tagging

projects.title: Automatic Distractor Generation for Python Parson's Problems
work: A tool currently under development that automatically generates distractors based on common programming errors from an introductory Python course.
The tool can be accessed here: https://github.com/CoffeePoweredComputers/DistractingParsonsGen

projects.title: Teaching Endorsement in Computer Science
projects.client: University of Illinois @ Urbana-Champaign - College of Education
work: Currently working to develop CI 487 - Data Structures for CS Teachers
Developing a set of interactive Jupyter Notebook based worksheets: https://github.com/CoffeePoweredComputers/487-data-structures-worksheets

projects.title: High Performance Computing Time-Series Visualization Dashboard
projects.client: Dr. Tanzima Islam, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, Western Washington University
work: Project targeted the analysis of large quantities of multidimensional time series data
Involved in the development of a data visualization dashboard, implemented using the following:
Server - Implemented with the Bottle package for Python and SQLite3
Visualizations - The helix visualization was implemented with ThreeJS and the bar/line graph was implemented with D3.js
